episodes.title: Cancer Conspiracy Theories: Why Did Our Sister Die?
episodes.description: Marianna Spring investigates the rise of health conspiracy theories. Are social media companies’ algorithms pushing potentially harmful content at vulnerable patients?

episodes.title: Panorama - Andrew Tate: Accused
episodes.description: Oana Marocico returns to her home country to investigate Andrew and Tristan Tate's Romanian webcam business and speaks to women who claim they’ve been abused by the brothers.

episodes.title: The Billionaire Bishop and the Global Megachurch
episodes.description: With more than 30 branches in the UK, the Universal Church of the Kingdom of God, led by a Brazilian billionaire businessman, claims to transform lives through its preaching. But Panorama uncovers allegations that members can feel manipulated into giving money to the church, that it tells young members mental health conditions are linked to evil spirits which can be ‘cast out’ by what it calls, strong prayers; and that it persuades members to stay with the church by suggesting that leaving can lead to serious illness.
subjects: Universal Church Of The Kingdom Of God

episodes.title: Panorama - The Abercrombie Guys: The Dark Side of Cool
episodes.description: Panorama investigates allegations of exploitation and abuse at the top of one of the biggest fashion brands in the US.

episodes.title: The Secrets Of Scientology
episodes.description:
Reporter John Sweeney's last investigation into the Church of Scientology resulted in an explosive confrontation with church officials. This time, in a Panorama Special, one of those officials has turned whistleblower to help him reveal the dark secrets of the church,which boasts Hollywood A-listers Tom Cruise and John Travolta among its devotees.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00v1ykr

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Secrets_of_Scientology

episodes.title: Scientology And Me
episodes.description:
An investigation into the Church of Scientology, endorsed by Hollywood celebs, which continues to face criticism that it is less of a religion and more of a cult.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b007jdf3
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientology_and_Me

episodes.title: 'The definition of religion (...) is not defined by John Sweeney.'
episodes.description: Tommy Davis (Spokesperson of the Church of Scientology) and John Sweeney (BBC Panorama).
